criteria: Understanding the historical context of Islam's origins, including pre-Islamic Arabia and the socio-political conditions that influenced Muhammad.
Knowledge of the key events in the life of Muhammad, from his birth and early life in Mecca to his migration to Medina (Hijra) and his eventual return to Mecca.
Comprehension of the core teachings of Muhammad and the central tenets of Islam, including the concept of Tawhid (Oneness of God), the role of prophets, and the importance of the Quran.
Understanding of the relationship between Islam, Judaism, and Christianity, including shared prophets, religious concepts, and historical interactions.
